citation.article-title: Bacillus acidiproducens sp. nov., vineyard soil isolates that produce lactic acid
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus acidiproducens sp. nov.
Bacillus acidiproducens (a.ci.di.pro.du′cens. N.L. n. acidum an acid; L. part. adj. producens producing; N.L. part. adj. acidiproducens acid-producing).
Cells are facultatively anaerobic, Gram-positive-staining rods (0.8−1.2×4.0−4.5 μm) that contain subterminal ellipsoidal spores.
Colonies grown on TSA are round, flat and white or ivory (5.0 mm in diameter).
Grows at pH 6.0–7.5; optimum growth at pH 7.0.
Positive for catalase, acetoin and lactic acid production.

Negative for oxidase, reduction of nitrate and nitrite, hydrolysis of gelatin, casein, DNA and Tween 80, β-galactosidase (ONPG) and methyl red test, formation of H2S and indole and activities of phosphatase, urease, phenylalanine deaminase and ornithine and lysine decarboxylases.
Utilizes glycerol, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, galactose, glucose, fructose, mannose, rhamnose, mannitol, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, sucrose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose and gluconate.
The diagnostic amino acid is meso-diaminopimelic acid and the major cell-wall sugars are glucose and galactose.
Major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, C16 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46.3 mol%.
The type strain, SL213T (=KCTC 13078T =JCM 14638T), was isolated from vineyard soil in Daejeon, Korea.
Strain SL1213, isolated from the same source, is a second strain of the species.
